contentrichtext.text: '''Hans-Martin Linde''' (born May 24, 1930 in [[Werne]], [[Germany]]) is a noted virtuoso [[flute]] and [[recorder (musical instrument)|recorder]] player of (mainly) baroque and [[early music]]. He authored a number of original and highly instructive books on the flute and recorder respectively. * ''Recorder Player Handbook'' (Handbuch des BlockflÃ¶tenspiels, 1997) * ''Complete F recorder method'' * ''Complete C recorder method'' * ''Studies in the French clef for recorder'' * ''History of fipple-flutes'' He then set up the Linde Consort (a baroque orchestra) and has made numerous recordings. ==External links== *[http://www.bach-cantatas.com/Bio/Linde-Hans-Martin.htm Short biography with some photos] {{Authority control|VIAF=7574522}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Linde, Hans-Martin | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = May 24, 1930 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Linde, Hans-Martin}} [[Category:1930 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Werne]] [[Category:German classical flautists]] [[Category:Schola Cantorum Basiliensis faculty]] [[Category:Recorder flute players]] [[Category:Recorder players]] {{Germany-writer-stub}} {{germany-classical-musician-stub}} {{flautist-stub}}
